intro: Lithospermum arvense proles permixtum, commonly known as the mixed prairie lithospermum, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It has small, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
